p: To avoid environmental impacts, nanoparticle polymer coatings need to be biodegradable and innocuous. Poly (Îµ-caprolactone) (PCL) is an aliphatic polyester with such characteristics; furthermore, it is biocompatible. PCL has been used in the controlled release of active pharmaceutical compounds since the 1970s [ 26, 27]. These factors led to an interest in combining PCL with biopesticides for agricultural applications.
